page.title: 15RECREATION IN KETTLEWELL
page.content: The Youth Hostel - In the last 12 months this has provided 42,000 meals and 12,000 bed-nights, catering for groups, schools and individuals. It is one of only six activity centres listed by the Y.H.A., and is also a Y.T.S. training centre for Manpower Services. Caving, climbing, pony-trekking, cycling, visits to farms and lead-mines are part of its schemes. Hag Dyke - once a lonely farmhouse high up on Great Whernside, is now an adventure hostel, with beds for 40 young people, up to 600 bed-nights a year, run by 1st Ben Rhydding Scout Troop since snow-bound 1947. The chapel adjoining is believed to be Englands highest place of worship. A wall-plaque commemorates the 40 Allied airmen of World War II who died on the surrounding hills.
